title: People are too obsessed with the meta
body:
I just wanted to play mid Varus AP yesterday and everyone left the Team Builder the moment they saw me and accused me of trolling. When I finally found a team, my team said I was a troll when I got killed for the first time. The enemy Kalista accused me of trolling and insulted. 
[When I ended up 21/4](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1754660757/212202356?tab=overview) after 4 consecutively triple kills and nuked any of them with one ult + one AA, they stopped talking (Kalista still reported me at the end xD poor mad girl).
People is too obsessed with the meta. The moment they see something different that is absolutely viable, they freak out. We HAVE TO do something about this if we want to see more diversity and keep having fun with this game. We need to promote diversity and show why the meta is ok but it is not the only thing that there is. 
Otherwise people's minds will just be closer and closer to anything different.

Part of the problem is, people don't even know what the meta even means anymore.

When they say "that's not Meta!" They actually mean "That's not what the Pros did last weak" 

Of course not! Pro's take the meta, then practice a very specific application of it with very little variation, so they become better at that specific strategy. But that only works in fixed teams!

SoloQ has to reiterpret the meta every game.

"The Meta" itself are just some simple realisations about the game, like:
- Midlane get's the most XP, so should have a level scaling champ.
- Duolanes get more gold through kills and assists, so should have item scaling champs.
- toplane has to be able to stay solo for a while.

In that regard Urgot actually is a meta pick for top, kinda sturdy and pretty save. He just is not a meta pick for botlane because with his utility and lack of good AA, he doesn't scale that well with items.

This is why the report function is broken cause whiny kids that get proven wrong can still spam "Verbal Abuse/Negative Attitude" reports and get you chat restricted or even ranked restricted. I try to stick to the meta to avoid arguments, but when I know something is going to work in a ranked game I do it regardless of what my team thinks. My best example of this is when the enemy team picks Zed mid and I get to mid I use Shen cause Shen shuts him down so hard.

Also: you have a lot of people are against "weekly free champions"... 

Oh no! This week [blank] champion is free! Don't let him get into our Team (in Team Builder)!!!

Seriously???  How does anyone learn a new champion if no one tries it in the first place?

> People is too obsessed with the meta. The moment they see something different that is absolutely viable, they freak out. 

That's why this community sucks.

On the same token, as soon as anyone sees something in the LCS, it's like they've been enlightened by some higher power that shows them "Yo, it's not just the same 20 champions. Let others on the field." and then they do... until the next patch comes around and they guard the precious sanctity of their win-rate like certain champions plan to steal it like gold from a vault. 

Seriously, some people put way too much stock in the LCS, whether by allowing "meta" picks, not allowing "off-meta" picks, or playing the same "meta" champions 10-20 games in a row because it's "totes OP guis." It seems like people are just continually shoving their head up the ass of the LCS players for no discernible reason. "LCS players didn't pick it therefore I shouldn't!" "LCS players picked it, so I should spam the fuck out of it!"

I've been playing Lissandra since her release, because I love her. And I have had to stand people telling me she was useless and "reasoning" why for 2 years. Now I have to stand the same people telling me she's OP and she deserves nerves.

Ugh people like that are so annoying. I love playing support, and sometimes I feel like going off-META.

For example in a Blind Pick, I saw that the ADC I was playing with was Ezreal, so I decided to go for a Malphite support since he's a relatively safe ADC that could get away. During the whole laning phase I zoned out the enemy Varus and Leona to the point where Varus was down 40+ CS and poked them out of lane multiple times. 

When Zed decides to roam bot, I ping Ez to back off, but he decides to farm because that seems more important, so I decided to lock down Zed hoping Ez would realize to finally leave. Unfortunately, he ignored Leona's obvious cues that a gank was going down and got chain CC'd to death. For the rest of the game he harassed me for picking Malphite and said I should just unistall, even though I engaged on the enemy carries constantly and peeled for my team. We won the game and it wasn't even close.

My only advice is that whenever people start harassing you, just respond "k." It just really annoys them to know that you heard what they are saying, and choosing to ignore them anyways. (:

Yeah, offmeta supports are fun, until anything goes wrong and then suddenly its all your fault. Doesn't matter if the Vayne tumbled into Braum level 1 and tried to melee him to death, or top laner never connected the game, it's "gg play a real support noob reported"
I love off-meta stuff. Feel free to add me if you feel like running AP Varus or whatever again, and want to have an easier time finding a team.

My friend played Nunu mid and wrecked Katarina.  She flamed him all game in chat, and called him an idiot for going against the meta.  My reply?  Looks like he wasn't such an idiot since he won lane hard and is carrying.  She still continued to flame for going against the meta and said she would report for a troll pick since she died so much to him.
That's why you play with your friends and turn off /all chat. You can do whatever you like and have fun, that's what games are meant for, right?

I don't care about meta in normals, do what the hell you want.

I've seen muramana trist in ranked though, as a serious build - so, some people are a bit jaded to 'off meta' picks.

I played a normal draft against an ADC azir that fed me six kills then afkd, we won in 20 mins. - Not everyone is like this but a lot of people who play off meta stuff are quick to jump to the defense of playing poorly or just having their off-meta pick not work.

You CAN make adc azir and AP varus work but you should be ready to take the blame for winding up completely useless if you do fall behind.

I honestly don't really care about what you build in ranked (with a few exceptions. if our jungler doesn't have a jungle item, I know we're screwed. He's giving up way too much free gold) What I really care about is what you do. It's so frustrating to see teams meander around in our jungle when they could be placing wards and  pushing towers as a group.
People focus too much on meta and counters, If you are good at a champion, play them.
I love me some AP Varus, strong early game poke, huge late game burst damage, and you can 100-0 3 people at once with your AoE abilities and a Runaan's.

People want to win games.

If you take AP Varus mid over a hundred games, with teammates and against opponents at the same skill level as you, playing champions they are comfortable playing, do you think you'd manage even close to a 50% win rate?  It is highly unlikely.

Does not having a marksman on your team sometimes work?  Yes.  Will it win consistently?  No.

In any competitive game, a meta develops for a reason.  If your goal is to win games, there is a right way to play.  Hell, there are several right ways.  There are also wrong ways.  I'm sorry, but that is just the fact of it.  If you want to play something off-meta, expect extreme skepticism.  Expect people to be upset because they want to win and you are decreasing the overall likelihood of that happening.  Expect to have to wait longer in Teambuilder for a game.  Expect to have to prove that you aren't trolling.  Expect people to be upset if you don't do well.

If you can't deal with all those things, then don't go off-meta.  It is really that simple.  Either shut up and deal with it, or don't do it.
